      • isUsingGCCallsToTrackMemory

        public boolean isUsingGCCallsToTrackMemory()
        Gets the flag that determines if System.gc() is called at beginning and end of each segment to more accurately track memory usage.
        Returns:
        True if this CodePerfTracker is using System.gc() calls at beginning and end of segments to obtain more accurate memory usages. False otherwise.

      • useGCToTrackMemory

        public void useGCToTrackMemory(boolean useGCCalls)
        By setting this flag, more accurate memory usage numbers can be captured. The tradeoff is that System.gc() calls can increase total runtime of the program (although the call is not included in measured runtime).
        Parameters:
        useGCCalls - Sets a flag that uses System.gc() calls at the beginning and end of segements to obtain more accurate memory usages.
